title: 'Power is addictive'...
text: show ad George W. Bush won't agree with Trump's view of reporters as 'the enemy' as he says 'power is addictive' and 'we need an independent media to hold people like me to account' Former U.S. president George W. Bush said Monday that a free press was 'indispensable to democracy' during his two White House terms 'I think power can be very addictive, and it can be corrosive, and it's important for the media to call to account people who abuse their power,' he said President Donald Trump has called a handful of media outlets 'fake news' Bush also said the 'split-up' nature of the news media is partly to blame for America's nationwide political schisms Published: 13:52 GMT, 27 February 2017 | Updated: 16:08 GMT, 27 February 2017 157 shares
